Parallels.ab: dātārəm vohunąm dāmanąm ābiiō rātābiiō zaōϑrābiiō aršuxδaēibiiasca vāγžibiiō vīspəmca aṣ̌auuanəm maińiiaōm yazatəm yazamaide ~ Y16.2 ābiiō rātābiiō zaōϑrābiiō aršuxδaēibiiasca vāγžibiiō vīspəmca aṣ̌auuanəm gaēϑīm yazatəm yazamaide.

aršuxδaēibiiasca vāγžibiiō = VrS15.1; ~ Y9.25 vacąm ərəžuxδanąm [...] ərəžǔxδəm [...] vācim; ~ Y7.30 aršuxδəm vācim; ~ Y60.5 aršuxδō vāxš; ~ Y71.10 vacō aršuxδa; ~ Y27.8 aršuxδanąmcā vacąm; ~ VrS31.13 aršuxδanąmca vacaŋhąm (!), etc.
vīspəmca aṣ̌auuanəm maińiiaōm yazatəm yazamaide = Y25.4 Šnūman Nō Nāwar acc.

ab.ab: "The chief priest, after taking the mortar from the table, puts (it) upside down inside the water container; and the chief priest recites alone."
"At the start of this chapter, the zōt picks up the mortar with his right hand and sets it upside down on the table, grasping it by the base and placing it inverted in the large basin of water."
